website_summaries.verdict: It’s portable, affordable, and has plenty of space. It supports high-end features like remote access at a competitive price.
pros: Included software allows you to access files on the drive remotely
Users report fast transfer speeds using USB 3.0
A great price, especially considering the capacity
cons: It’s got a hard drive inside, not a solid-state drive
It’s formatted NTFS by default, so Mac users will need to install Toshiba’s custom NTFS driver, which can be a pain

customer_reviews.title: Try copying over 250 Gigs of data.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple Canvio drives in this exact size. one failed after several years of service. These new drives are horrible. At first I thought I just got a bad one (It happens) so I sent for a replacement. The new one is just as bad as the first. I get about 20 gigs transfered into it and the throughput drops off . I am not sure if it is due to heat or what, but it never increased in speed even after letting sit for an hour. (both drives)
customer_reviews.author: P. Moran

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!  Had 2 fail out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I've never been more disappointed with a product from Amazon. We went through two of these drives. The first had the click of death out of the box. Well such is life; easy exchange from Amazon, had the replacement in a couple days. Upon receiving the 2nd drive it seemed to work and I started a 100GB backup of my PC. I came back to check on it and found the drive read errors. I disconnected and reconnected the USB; DRIVE CLICK OF DEATH!! The Toshiba brand use to be some of the best products money could buy so I don't know what happened but this drive is garbage! BEWARE! AVOID LIKE A LOVE SICK ZOMBIE!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Righteous

customer_reviews.title: Great 1 TB external drive for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've been needing to upgrade my external backup solution for some time now. So when I saw this drive, I had to order it so I could retire my aging 500 GB external drive (which was also from Toshiba) Pros: -This drive has excellent read/write performance when compared with my old drive (CrystalDiskMark images attached) -This drive was very easy to encrypt with Windows BitLocker, only took a minute to encrypt it. -Came with a new USB type A to MicroUSB type B cable. Cons: -Construction: The outer plastic body feels cheap and is flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am sooo pissed off!!! I put over 97000 files on the drive but now the drive does not display when I plug it into my computer. WTF am I supposed to do now? Send it to their warranty center so they can see my personal photos, my life, passwords, bank information, etc? Hardly think so. Last seven years of my life no longer available. All my kids pictures GONE! Do NOT purchase this drive! You load it but it will not again allow you to access your information! So angry!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Utter garbage, have only owned it for a month and now none of my computers understand that it exists. When I plug it in it either doesn't show up anywhere or it freezes the entire computer. Now I'm probably going to lose all the information that I stored on it in that month's time. So thanks a lot stupid toshiba. No self help sight has been helpful either since anything and everything you can do to try and fix the problem requires the device to be able to understand that the external hard drive exists, which, as I stated, my computers do not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working - no response to support request
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working within weeks of receiving. I contacted support, as the item supposedly carried support for the first few months after purchase. Received no response whatsoever. Poor quality product. Poor (non-existent) customer support.
customer_reviews.author: ZC

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: If you ever want to remove hard drive and ise it elsewhere than don’t buy this. This device is sealed and hacking it will destroy it. I will never buy anything Toshiba again.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Works with PS4
customer_reviews.text: Got this HDD for extra PS4 storage. Note to PS4 users... your system might reject the hard drive the first time you boot up. Just restart the PS4 with the HDD plugged in. Update -- all of the PS4 games I installed on this HDD started running with performance issues recently. Very long load times, audio cutting out... basically rendered them unplayable. I formatted the HDD and re-downloaded the games but still no luck. Disc-based games run okay (not great) and digital games are unplayable.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Graw

customer_reviews.title: 2 failed disks within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these 2TB models in August 2018, and today, 23 March 2019 (6 months later!), two of the drives are reported by SMART Utilities and TechTech Pro 9 as "FAILING" (numerous bad sectors). They were mainly used for daily or weekly backups; now I know that I cannot rely on this manufacturer, which is really too bad because there are so few manufacturers of Hard Drives these days. Once I could depend on Hitachi drives (as did nearly everyone else in the industry where reliability was paramount), but once they were bought out and merged with Western Digital, that isn't the case anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan P. Saltzman

customer_reviews.title: Melting
customer_reviews.text: well I'm not sure about this one.... been using it for a few weeks with no issues. The drive worked well. However, now I've noticed that the bottom of the drive seems to be melting on the edges. It has a burning smell emitting from the plastic as well. I no longer use it due to concerns of a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Pulliam

customer_reviews.title: Backup Failed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these drives, one to use as a Time Machine and one as a regular backup hard drive. Both were easily reformatted for mac. The regular back up drive appears to be working fine, although I just transferred data to it one time, so it isn't being "tested" on a regular basis. The other, for Time Machine, is repeatedly causing my imac to generate "Backup failed" messages. Not sure it is failing every time, but clearly it is either defective or the wrong drive for the job. These drives look good on paper. High capacity and easily portable, but if they don't work right, who cares?
customer_reviews.author: M. Ricker

customer_reviews.title: Very wide compatibility range
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I didn’t buy this sooner. Alright, opening the box, you have the drive, cable, and warranty information. The cable is fairly short, but it is passable. The compliance this has with what I have is vast, works brilliantly with a laptop that’s about fifteen years old. Setup was easy, connect cable to drive, connect cable to machine, wait for the OS to recognise the drive and install appropriate drivers, and done. This drive works with Windows 2000 up to the latest release of Windows 10. I’ve yet to test this on any of the Macs I own or if it plays nice with Unix. So... Cons: The cable is quite short, roughly 30cm. Pros: Everything else
customer_reviews.author: Extant Novartis

customer_reviews.title: Failed after the very first use.
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked my product, I connected it to my computer, I started transferring data from my computer to the device, suddenly after a few minutes it started making a strange sound like "TIC, TIC, TIC" and it froze and it did not work anymore. Just at the very first use. I could not transfer the data, I lost my money and my time. #CheapIsExpensive
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is portable and in affordable price but all the Youtube reviews tell it has reliability issue and I did get error message already in only few months of using it (it worked after I unplug it and reconnected after few seconds). Definitely budget friendly product but if you have enough money go for something more reliable like SSD external drive.
customer_reviews.author: Haejoo

customer_reviews.title: NOT "easy set-up"; NOT "simple plug-and-play operation".
customer_reviews.text: This product is described as "easy to use with no software to install", "ready to use", "easy set up", and "simple plug-and-play operation". The instruction manual states: "1. Connect the USB cable to the drive and the computer. 2. Turn on the computer." When I followed the directions, nothing happened. I called technical support and was asked if I know how to cut and paste. Uh, I guess so, but not if I don't know what to cut and what to paste, and where to do it. So I guess NO, I don't know? He advised me to return the product and get one that incudes software. I will be returning this. I am so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Donnette Lennox

customer_reviews.title: Lost all of my data. Don't go the cheap route. Broken after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hard drive to make a system image before sending my laptop off for repair. Repairs required a wipe of my laptop. Plugged in this hard drive just to find that it is already curropted and completely unusable. I lost all of my data! It was used once and placed in a drawer. The second time I tired to use it... I was hosed. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: I should have looked closer at the product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a 4TB hard drive to backup my tower. I had a Toshiba 2TB previously and it has been working very well. The price was right on this drive so I ordered it without looking more closely. On getting the hard drive I was surprised that it did not have an external power supply. OK not a problem. But the USB cord that comes with it is proprietary and VERY short. So not good for backing up a tower system as it won't reach any of the USB ports on the back of my system. I will need to use a USB extension cable. This drive is apparently designed with a laptop computer in mind.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: High storage, low price, speed of syrup
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any errors with this drive. I ran a full integrity check on it before putting any data on it. It's been simple to use and it's a very light and portable backup drive. If you need to move a lot of data quickly then choose something else. It takes this thing roughly an hour to move 100gb. I got this as an occasional failsafe/media drive knowing that it would be slow so I'm not bothered by it, but I have an 8 year old Seagate GoFlex that runs circles around this thing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I want a refund
customer_reviews.text: This device was alright at first, but today I had to completely delete over 300gb worth of storage because the device randomly corrupted itself out of nowhere. I can't even have it plugged in for a minute without getting a error message about it and I lost over 10 games because of the stupid thing. I bought this back in May, but MAYbe I shouldn't have bought it. I genuinely want a refund because this is just bs that I have to go through this. This item is almost $100, it doesn't feel like it with how bad it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: disc failed after sitting unused in a drawer for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: i backed up my computer onto the disc and left it in a drawer for 6 months. When I took it out to perform another back up, it was no longer "mounting" on my computer, and disc utility is reporting it failed. What a waste of $50. Not sure I will be able to recover all the stored files. :(
customer_reviews.author: eshaf

customer_reviews.title: Crashed in less than 7 months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October of last year and it is completely unresponsive. I had all my family pictures on here! now it won't work! I've lost everything! DONT BUY! I should have stuck with WD, I've never had a problem with those.. don't know why I trusted this drive.. needless to say, I'm never buying again.. all my kid's pictures are gone!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hex-zon

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Machine
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how this little guy was perfect for someone like me. It literally was drag and drop. I have tried other backups that required a bit of finagling, but not this little beast. I just plugged it in and dragged what I needed to it. Everything loaded much faster than I thought. I backed up 35,000 music files and over 25,000 photos and everything loaded in under an hour. Then I just organized everything from the backup and it was perfect. I would recommend this 100%
customer_reviews.author: D.Vito

customer_reviews.title: 1 TB external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is easy to plug into my PC. The instructions are simple. I do wish that the instructions provided the answers to some questions I had, since I am low tech - such as: 1. does a new back up overwrite the last back up, or does it only update the files/folders that contain new info 2. How do you know that the back up is done? 3. Can you back up more than one PC using the same external drive and still have access to each one? As you can see, I am not tech savvy... Guess I'll have to search elsewhere for the answers.
customer_reviews.author: Shredder

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for about a few months... ...then died
customer_reviews.text: After my 2 year old hard drive died after copying files, I decided to get this external HDD. First of all, this drive is very cheaply made, with the port for the micro USB slot being warped after 3 months of use. Next, the drive started getting VERY slow (meaning its coming close to dying) a few months later, and then it died. I will NOT recommend this for people who want reliability for their data, I almost LOST a BUNCH of old files that was on this HDD.
customer_reviews.author: snowcool776

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and portable for my peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 60+ years old and not tech savvy in the least. I needed a small, portable external hard drive to back up the recipe book I've been working on for several years. My son recommended this one because it has a lot of storage capacity. I was just a little intimidated when it arrived but it was so easy to use! Just plugged it in and my computer recognized it right away. Saving my files is so easy and I no longer worry that I will lose all my hard work.
customer_reviews.author: Jill S

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba HDTB420XK3AA Canvio Basics 2TB...Click of Death
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could be one of those 5 star purchasers but I ended up being a 1 star purchaser. While formatting the drive it got about 10% into the format when the drive started disconnecting and reconnecting over and over while the drive sat and clicked away. Now I will be looking at buying a bare drive and a case and assemble one myself. I have had good luck in the past doing that but the price of the Toshiba clouded my judgment.
customer_reviews.author: D. Spaeth

customer_reviews.title: mac external drive not ejected properly after connecting it
customer_reviews.text: I have a macbook pro 13" 2016 , if I have too many usbs plugged in (interface, ilock usb key, MIDI) when I plug this in, after 3 seconds it says that it did not eject properly. I have to remove all other USBs before plugging this in to ensure it won't do that. It's frustrating, I understand I can simply remove the other USB but this does not happen with an older Seagate external drive that I have! Please let me know what I can do, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba drives are a great value
customer_reviews.text: For more than 10 years, Toshiba has been my go-to choice when it comes to external hard drives. They have always proved to be dependable and tough, whether I am working with a desktop or laptop machine. This 4TB drive was more than enough to back up the files of two desktops and a laptop. This drive is plug and play with USB 3.0. Though some have complained about the write speed on Tosh drives, they have always been fast enough for my needs when I am editing video or audio and need portability. Once again, Toshiba has met my expectations. I was so impressed I ended up buying a second drive less than a month later for another location.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Paul

customer_reviews.title: USB 3.0 port fails easily; no longer made with SATA connecter
customer_reviews.text: After 13 months and about 2 uses per month, this Toshiba (HDTB420XK3AA) Canvio Basics 2TB HDD no longer responded/powered-up when connected to a PC. The USB 3.0 itself always felt a bit flimsy and after removing the case to use a SATA connector to recover data, I discovered Toshiba no longer manufactures this style of HDD with SATA anymore. That means it will likely be more difficult and costly to recover data if the USB 3.0 fails. The older Toshiba models were made with SATA and of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: sirnovelsgood

customer_reviews.title: Mac owners be careful
customer_reviews.text: I am running Mac OS10.14.5 in my MacBook Pro, and bought this drive so I could have a bootable backup. I reformatted it for Mac and it did back up the hard drive data, but I couldn’t get it to appear in the Startup Disk window no matter what I tried. I checked with Amazon tech support and learned that, “it won't be bootable because it isn't the partition mac prefers.” The product page on Amazon says that the drive is compatible with Mac, and I suppose it is, up to a point, but it certainly wouldn’t be useful if it isn't bootable and my system were to malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: Dof

customer_reviews.title: Ordered for use with 2015 Macbook pro
customer_reviews.text: Ran out of space on my Macbook pro, decided to go the external HD route rather than deal with installing a larger hard drive in the Mac. Plugged in the HD and the mac asked me if I wanted to use time machine which I did not, told the software no and proceeded to go to finder / disk utilities to format the HD to the MAC OS Extended ( journaled) with no issues. Works perfectly and was affordable, very happy with the purchase and use.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Don't even know how it died....
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine when I first bought it. Put some data on it to help a friend of mine. Since then, it's been in my dresser drawer for a few months, and when I whipped it out to use it as backup for my computer, it didn't work at all. The light comes on for about 15 seconds, then shuts off, and the computer doesn't recognize that it's there.It doesn't work on ANY computer I've tried. Tried to contact tech support aaaannnddd... nothing. Guess it's a paperweight, now. Only 8 months in.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sangster

customer_reviews.title: speed issue
customer_reviews.text: have the 2tb version. started out working fine - transferred about 600 gigs of data no issue (transfer speeds were fast - in the 100mbs range constantly). tried adding some files the other day, and again today, and the throughput kept dropping and stalling out - it would start around 80mbs then within a few seconds drop to less than 1mbs, then stall, then intermittently transfer files in the 50-100kbs range. i tried it on two different systems, with the same issue on both. i optimized the drive for performance and still nothing. tried teracopy and that too was no help. with no other option, it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: albee

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous. Absolutely NOT intuitive, helpful, or useful
customer_reviews.text: The instructions suggest this is a plug and play device. The instructions are wrong. The device is not recognized, does not register, and there is no easy set up. I've wasted hours googling, trying to find out how to make this thing actually useful and I give up. I returned the first one, thinking it was merely a fluke that it didn't work. Amazon sent a replacement and it's the same thing. The stupid slip of paper included in the box gives explicit instructions on how to attach the USB cable from the computer to the hard drive. DUH! Beyond that, nothing. Absolutely useless. I used to have confidence in Toshiba. Not so much now. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Giles

customer_reviews.title: Used item. Not new.Very unhappy with Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I received a used item as new. Unsealed open package with dust particles on drive and couple of Nick's. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: R. K

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, So Much Storage and Easy To Use!
customer_reviews.text: I mean wow, why did I wait so long to get one of these and upgrade my Xbox One! I was always deleting games to reinstall new ones based on the limited storage of Xbox and finally pulled the trigger on this a couple months ago and wish I did years ago. Extremely easy to setup and integrate with your system (and a responsive tech support is on standby) ! It’s very small and sleek looking making its portability extremely high and it not stand out or look bad when used! The storage capacity is amazing as I’ve gone from 4 installed games to now 20!! What a game changer...literally!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Great for movie storage on my smart TV
customer_reviews.text: I love old sci-fi movies like Them! and The Giant Gila Monster, but I also have a good sized collection of modern movies that I've ripped to personal digital copies. 742 total movies that are more than 2TB. The 4TB capacity (3.62TB actual capacity due to how bytes are calculated) is enough for another 500 movies or more. Connected to the USB port on my smart TV, playback is smooth. Transfer rate from the old hard drive to this new hard drive was 100MB/sec to 140MB/sec on my computer. Speed will depend on your computer and USB ports. As well made as other external drives I've had. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: R. ODonnell

customer_reviews.title: perfect size, LOTS of storage
customer_reviews.text: Unless you're intentionally hoarding data to fill this thing, it will take quite a while to bite into its space. I have it chock full of photos, documents, videos, music, and still haven't even come close to filling it up a third of the way. It doesn't conflict at all with other devices, and there's no hassle in unplugging it to take it anywhere. It fits in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah-BEX

customer_reviews.title: Amazing 3TB!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! It's been awhile since I bought an external. I take quite a few photos and I use an external hard drive for storage. My old drive was a 1 TB Samsung and it was 8 or 9 years old. No issues, just getting old and not wanting to lose any photos, I wanted a new one. The old 1 TV was about the size of a stack of DVD cases. And noisy... It didn't run all the time but when accessed, would run the drive and it's fan. The new 3 TB Toshiba is solid state, silent, and barely bigger than a pack of cigarettes. Very easy to transfer files out of the old and into the new. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Ken K. in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive external storage with good performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 1 TB version of this drive and just got done transferring a bunch of files from my desktop. I'm happy with the performance. One thing that might be of interest to people considering this drive is the real-world transfer speed. I've attached a photo showing the speed on a large (179 GB) transfer that was about 2/3 complete. The source drive was a WD black 2TB 7200 rpm drive, and the Toshiba external drive was connected to a USB 3.0 port using the provided cable. 50 MB/sec might not be blazing fast, but I feel like it's a solid performance when you consider the price of this drive.
customer_reviews.author: LazyMoose

customer_reviews.title: Of two purchased, one went bad after two uses
customer_reviews.text: These drives were usable from the Fedora version of Linux. They didn't automount, but a person familiar with the command line interface can mount them. To back up my home directory of about 400 GB took several hours using a USB-3 connection. The write speed on these drives isn't impressive. I bought two these hard drives. On of them didn't work with the cables that were provided. It worked with the cables that came with the other drive - which is to say that it worked for two uses. Then it gave the "click of death" and failed. The failure occurred on the third use of the drive to backup my home directory.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Tashiro

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality - drive failed after 2 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Given all the storage industry has learned over the years, I thought drive failures would be exceedingly rare. Not the case. This drive failed within 2 weeks of light use. No moving around either - it only sat on my desk. Update: the replacement failed after 6 months of use. Never buy one of these. I'm actually quite shocked this happened twice. You would think I used this in a heavy vibration environment, but it's literally been sitting in the same place, plugged into my machine, with light-duty use. This is the worst reliability I've seen since Seagate 512MB drives back in the mid 90's.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing solid & reliable performance
customer_reviews.text: As a mobile DJ in today’s era the most important tool you have is your music. What hard drive you trust to store your music is crucial. This toshiba hard drive did not disappoint! Pros: -USB 3.0 Blazing speeds (usb 2 compatibile) -Lightweight (similar to an iPhone) -Strong cable ports -Found a case for under $10 to travel with -Fast loading speeds & doesn’t heat up Cons: -The standard cable was only a foot. As expected But to flop over to a Pro you can get cables on amazon or anywhere for a few bucks any length you need. As a dj I always have backups !
customer_reviews.author: Straight from NYC|AJ B

customer_reviews.title: Good price but somewhat unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The price was nice and the storage is just what I needed. I sometimes have a problem with data corruption when transferring new files to this portable drive though. It is a USB 3.0 capable device so I am using a USB 3.0 port on my laptop to transfer things to it, but sometimes the final product is a corrupt file, so I have to delete it and re-copy. I have another portable 2.0TB hard drive that is a different model, and it works just fine where this one sometimes fails. Over-all the price was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: radicldreamr

customer_reviews.title: Small, beautiful, quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Loving this hard drive so far. Using as external storage on Xbox one. Very small form factor that can be hidden behind or on the side of the Xbox without being seen. It's also very quiet and doesn't get hot. Works about as fast as the internal drive on the Xbox. would recommend and definitely buy again in the future
customer_reviews.author: iTs Rush

customer_reviews.title: Loving so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Good transfer rate. I use it for my XboxOne. Just plug it into one of the 3.0 USB ports on the Xbox while its running and it should prompt you to format it. Do that and you can start transferring or downloading to it right away. Just make sure you designate it as your default storage, but I believe I was prompted to do that as well. As with all HDDs, try to protect it from possible falls or impacts wherever you decide to permanently place it.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Started failing after a year
customer_reviews.text: No wonder they offer only 1 year warranty for this thing. I was using it as a backup drive and it just started crashing. Now I can see that it has bad blocks all over it. Well it was $50 worth of a lesson never to buy anything Toshiba ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Mikler

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this very unreliable product!
customer_reviews.text: *Apparently, you can't submit a review unless you give it a least (1) star? I had this brand new drive for only two days, when it decided to ascend or in this case descend to the afterlife. I had copied/backup my personal data (about 700GB). This morning it will not power on, we have tried every "reasonable" method to get the drive to power on and nothing. Now, I'm stuck with a new external portable drive that has my data sitting on the platter and no way to retrieve it, short of paying a bizzilion dollars to a specialty house to surgically retrieve the data. Bottom line...avoid this product! This is very poor workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: LLF

customer_reviews.title: Disconnecting issues
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive worked fine for a little while then it started disconnecting on it's on. The main issue that I have is that I had games installed on the drive as well as movies and when you start playing the games or watching the movies it will disconnect on it's own and then reconnect. To me it's not worth the money at least not the one that I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bought in January, by March it quit working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's xbox one and it does not work. The games will download to storage, but then they will NOT save. As soon as you reopen the game and try to access the downloaded games on the external drive, they are GONE! We have tried redownloading several times, and everything WILL NOT SAVE. This is nothing more than a very expensive box that is USELESS! What a rip off. And of course it's just past the date that it's still returnable. :( So we are out money and have a useless external drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2jjr

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was stunned at the size of this storage device that I planned to transfer the contents of my computer hard drive to. What a change from the heavy, cumbersome external hard drive I bought a few years ago! A one click (from computer instructions) and everything simply transferred from the original to the security setting and it's still transferring from day to day, which is very comforting to me after losing more than one hard drive through the years. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Crandall

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken, or broke immediately.
customer_reviews.text: I have always trusted Toshiba as a brand, so they were my first go-to when I needed an external hard drive. The first one arrived broken internally, click of death and all. Call support with Toshiba and Amazon were both super helpful and got us the 2nd one with little to no hassle. The 2nd one worked for about 45 minutes before it completely failed and went into the click of death as well. I hate leaving a negative review for a company that I tend to respect, but this was just crazy. I don't know if there is a bad batch out right now, but I would not recommend purchasing this product at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Irle

customer_reviews.title: Typical 2.5" external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Performance is decent. I had purchased another of the same model 2 years ago, and bought this one to supplement it. Unfortunately, the old one developed issues died the day this one arrived. When I punch the model number into the Toshiba support web site, it tells me that the old one had a 3-year warranty. However, their RMA tool silently rejects its serial number so I guess they will not be replacing it. 2 years for a portable hard drive in continuous use isn't bad, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: i_reader

customer_reviews.title: quiet, fast, big storage for price
customer_reviews.text: Did some research before buying and Toshiba brand drives appear to have a very low failure rate. Bought this for backing up multiple home computers, archiving retired files, and bulk media storage for music. Seems to be working great, USB 1, 2, or 3, stays cool to the touch even when working hard, has a indicator LED when working, and is virtually noiseless. I do wish I had got it in a brightly colored case as it is small and flat black and easily disappears on a cluttered desk.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Works with PS4
customer_reviews.text: Compatibility with PS4 was the most important aspect I needed. This one worked perfectly as soon as it was hooked up.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly R Jackson

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: this external drive is highly risky
customer_reviews.text: I've had this 1TB external drive for 2 years, and as of April 2020, my PC for some reason cannot read it - no my laptop or other PC's can read it; in asking for assistance here on amazon, evidently another person has had same problem. I am currently trying to find ways to at least retrieve the important files I have in this external drive - especially files and data of my work place. Wow! I hope this is all possible. WARNING: this external drive is highly risky to store personal and work files!!!
customer_reviews.author: DeoKeju

customer_reviews.title: 2 months in, and so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: My Western Digital external hard drive broke after about 5 years of use, which I understand is a good lifespan for an external hard drive. After a lot of googling, I learned that some reviewers dislike how the new Western Digitals are built. I chose to buy a Toshiba as their reliability rates look to be top notch based on the research that I was able to do. This hard drive seems to be slower than my Seagate, but I'll try a little speed for reliability. I hope this one lasts as long as my Western Digital.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about a ransomware attack. Bought the 4TB. Just what I needed. Now I'm backing up all 3 of my computers to an external drive. It seemed to have problems working on one that had an 8-port USB hub, so I plugged it directly into the computer USB and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: What I expected and needed. Feels well made.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as external storage on my PlayStation 4. After the system formating it leaves 1.87 TB available. The cable it comes 2ith is short maybe about 1 foot or 2 feet. (Guessing) it vibrates when in use but not at an audible level. Even in the dead at night I don't hear it. Feels sturdy. About as thick as q deck or cards. It would easily fit in your pockets. Probably even in girl jeans with their tight pockets. Probably the size of a galaxy note I'd say. It has blue LED indicatot to indicate it's on. I would recommend and buy another if I need one.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great on older MacBook Pro!
customer_reviews.text: I used this external hard drive for my MacBook Pro. I plugged it in and time machine wanted to know if it was to be used as a backup. I clicked yes and it was formatted for my OS X El Capitan version 10.11.6. It started the backup and finished. I am very happy with this since I am a 71 year old and not that tech savvy. I would recommend this to anyone who just wants to backup their computer.
customer_reviews.author: Book girl

customer_reviews.title: Scary Reviews
customer_reviews.text: I got this HDD to backup my computer and perform an upgrade to my OS. After dealing with a previous one corrupting my data, I wanted to make sure this would hold all my files. I feel like I lucked out, and all of my files held on transfer. After completing the update to my computer I hope my files are still not corrupted! I will post an update if my files ever fail, but so far I am a happy camper with over 300gb's of data successfully transferred on my first try, with several over 20gb batches. So far so good, everything reads and loads.
customer_reviews.author: Things for his favorite

customer_reviews.title: Buy Insurance for critical data recovery.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great storage unit when it is working. I have two of these drives, the 1TB and the 4 TB. The 1TB works perfectly , and has for years; but the 4TB quit working about 5 weeks after I started using it. Fortunately, I didn't have too much critical information on the unit. That is where the recovery insurance would be helpful to recover the critical data. Thankfully Amazon worked with me and will replace the unit with an exact copy, which I hope works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Natural

customer_reviews.title: Works with my PS4, does what I wanted it to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to expand storage on my (basic) PS4. So far everything works great, and I like that it isn't very big. Make sure to follow formatting instructions on your PS4 (or other devices) and DO NOT IMPROPERLY DISCONNECT IT. The machine will have a fit. Also note that the computer functions you may have read about in the description (the document pre-installed on the machine and the "backup" feature) won't work/don't apply to the PS4. I mean of course you still have the warranty, you'll just have to go to the website. The backup doesn't happen or apply though, since it isn't connected to a computer.
customer_reviews.author: JKKHGG

customer_reviews.title: I stopped working within a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend anyone to get this Hard Drive, it strted giving me issues in the first couple of months of use but I didn't think too much of it, until recently it just completely stopped working. Doesn't even turn on when plugged in and now I have to pay from 500-1500$ to recover all the photos I had in there. Be careful, spend a little more, and insure your device if you're gonna get it so you don't end up like me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea L.

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 5 months. Cannot get Toshiba's RMA website to work.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine for 5 months. Used about once every 5 days to backup a NAS unit. Now reallocated sector count = 52 and backup to drive fails. Tried Toshiba's RMA service but website requests drive info, and then resets and requests same info repeatedly. Even if I could get the RMA to proceed, I have to return the drive at my expense, which is too high to be worth the hassle for a $60 product. I won't buy any more Toshiba drives.
customer_reviews.author: pjs

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this external hard drive. Was able to plug it in and move ALL, thousands, of my pictures right away. My computer runs better without all those pictures stored on it. I feel like my pictures are safe should my computer crash. I might lose work stuff but not my pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even last 6 months. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: The hard Drive didn’t even last a year barley half a year! And it started failing! When I contacted Toshiba to see what can be done, they where completely useless! They didn’t help at all. They just asked me to send back the hard drive and that they would refund the money. After I filed all the documents they asked for and sent them the hard drive they never answered me back and never sent a refund. This company is completely untrustworthy and their products don’t last!!! DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Torres

customer_reviews.title: Why aren’t there much better drives available for PS4 Pro?
customer_reviews.text: I needed a large capacity drive for backing up all my game files, but not the games themselves. My PS4 Pro insisted on formatting it for Extended memory before it would do anything else. The pop-up message was my data files could not be saved on the drive along with just about everything else if formatted for Extended memory. I canceled and disconnected the drive. Basically only games could be saved or installed. At some point I will need to move my games to an external drive, but none (including this one) is good enough. Will wait for a better mouse trap.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Montana

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good drives some TERRIBLE write speeds
customer_reviews.text: I order external hard drives as part of my job, on any given week I may go through 20 of them. I will no longer be ordering these, I got a batch where several had *TERRIBLE* write speed, as in no greater than 50KB/s which was tested both in Linux (badblocks & ddrescue) and Windows (CrystalDiskMark w/ formatted drive). Those are getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage : stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, I purchased several external hard drives : I still have 5 or 6 year-old Western Digital USB hard drives so as a safety measure, I decided to buy a new one and backup my data. I bought this drive in October 2019 and started to face slowness from time to time in January 2020, which is usually a bad sign. I retrieved all the data as I knew what was going to happen and it did, drive is completely unusable, cannot even format it. Total piece of garbage !
customer_reviews.author: French in NY

customer_reviews.title: What good is a warranty?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a drive in October 2019. It worked fine until September 2020. It is now DEAD. I'm sure the data is lost, that is unless I want to pay some company other than Toshiba, and I need to buy a new drive. The worst part of this entire affair is that I have to either go without backup for a week or turn of my computer until I can get a replacement drive. Who knows what Toshiba will do? Probably nothing useful.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Chucko

customer_reviews.title: Easiest to use tech product ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to FINALLY backup my 13 (yes thirteen) year old MAC computer (which hasn't so much as burped in 13 years). Using the built in MAC OS software the drive installed itself and backed up my hard drive automatically. It now does the same hourly. What else can you ask?
customer_reviews.author: GerryR

customer_reviews.title: No issues so far, would be nice to have rubberized "feet" though
customer_reviews.text: Just received this, no issues dragging and dropping files into the drive. It plus and plays from my Dell computer. One thing I noticed is how tight the plug grips the hard drive, I had to yank very hard to unplug it. I have no similar issues with the end that connects to my computer. I would've liked some rubberized nubs at the bottom side of the hard drive, keeps more secure footing on whatever it rests on.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lin

customer_reviews.title: Great product, sleek and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Kind of hard to argue with the price for the brand name, I've never had any trouble with any Toshiba product. I wish the cable was longer, just make sure to get a longer cable. The one that comes with it is not very generous in length and is frankly rather stiff. Not enough to effect the rating!
customer_reviews.author: smirkstudios

customer_reviews.title: Plug 'N' Play external backup drive for my Dell laptop
customer_reviews.text: Easy-peasy right out of the box. Plugged it into the USB 3.0 port of my Dell Windows 10 laptop, turned the PC on and the drive was instantly recognized. Programmed the Backup Option within Windows 10 and away it went. No formatting, no trying to find or access it, no backup issues. Excellent plug 'n' play value.
customer_reviews.author: Cousin Vinny

customer_reviews.title: SMR drive
customer_reviews.text: You can no longer get large ( >3 tb) 2.5” drives that are niot SMR platters. They are dog slow. Good for media or backups using drag and drop. For Time Machine backups or clones where data is deleted, they are really slow. That’s life in today’s hdd business. They work, that’s a plus compared to the Seagate's they replaced. The latter didn’t last a year. In spite of them (2) being replaced in the first month.
customer_reviews.author: RaytoTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home user
customer_reviews.text: This external hard drive is big enough for the average home user plus some. I work from home and have a ton of excel files and pictures and I am no where near filling it up. It is super easy to use, basically just plug it in and tell your pc to use it. It is small enough to take with you if you travel, but big enough that you won't lose it in your laptop bag like SOME PEOPLE seem to do with every single thumb drive ever used. Its about the size/weigh of an iphone 6 so it doesn't take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: April S

customer_reviews.title: No bad words to say only good because for the deal price is for 4tb is great.
customer_reviews.text: Compact, detachable cable, simple design, case is not protected so the disc need carefully handling. The working temp is ok. But I use external 14cm usb fan by ac infinity without chance to overheating. Speed is just OK and it depends how large the file you copy and capacity of each file, and the usb port you connect and the pc you use. The speed is declared and should be just OK. I use old PC only usb2 and the speed from 90 to 20 mb/s. The warranty is 1 year and is is not so good. But I take risk because I uses it for backup and with fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for Mac with one step
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a Mac. Yes it comes formatted for a PC and you need to reformat for Mac if you want full functionality but not a big deal. Plug in, Open ‘disk utility‘ to erase and rename. Boom- done in a minute. Used it for my Time Machine auto back up. Reads and writes fine.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Carlen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Apple Recommendation- Reformat it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and noticed that the function to create a New Folder was not available on my MBP 2019. If you need to work from the device it's pretty easy to get this going. Take everything you have on it, off and store it somewhere safely. Go to the disk utility while this HD is plugged in. Hit Erase and reformat it to one of the MAC OS formats. Should be good to go. One option does not have encryoption the other one does. It's up to you there. IF you need more help Google but this was my only issue so I did some research.
customer_reviews.author: Gino

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great.I bought this way back in 2018 and it still works fine. I see it is now available at a lower price than I paid for it. I like it and may have to order another one. Of course, I only use it to store data on so I don't fill up my desktop computers memory. Works great for me with no problems whatsoever. I have bought some from lesser known companies that stopped working within less than an hour of plugging in to my PC. So, I would go with Toshiba or another brand name rather than buying an inexpensive no name back up.
customer_reviews.author: James E Spencer

customer_reviews.title: My brother uses this
customer_reviews.text: He is bad about rolling the wheel chair over everything while he can see or use any part of his left side. I take chances with my drives, like last time he complained because he wheel would not turn, and I found my computer case with all my drives with him trying to roll over it. These can take more abuse than other drives, so I only get portable Seagate drives, the last one he had was a 2 terabyte drive for this same price, but I could not get it again.
customer_reviews.author: Archie A. Chipps

customer_reviews.title: REAAAAAALY SLOW
customer_reviews.text: Don't be mislead by the USB3 interface. The sustained write speed on this device is ~ 2MB/sec (when attached to the USB2 interface of a high-end Dell workstation). USB2 has a theoretical speed of 60MB/sec. I'd expect at least a transfer speed of 20MB/s (when nothing else is doing any I/O on that entire root hub); what I get is 10 times worse. The I/O speed in this case seems to be limited by the device, not the interface. This is for sustained writes while taking a backup, which I supposed would be a common usage. Random reads might benefit from from internal cache; I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hard drive on September, 2019. Today, out of nowhere. It suddenly stopped working anymore. I'm so upset because I have a lot of important documents in there. I bought it for the safety of my files but now because of the quality of the hard drive, I lost them. When I was trying to look up how to fix it and get back my files. It turned out it type of drive is impossible to fix. So stay away if you want to keep your file safe.
customer_reviews.author: Customer John.

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play - Even on a Macbook!
customer_reviews.text: My Macbook is about 5 years old and last time I updated the OS, it acted a little funky. Before upgrading to Mojave, I wanted to back up all of my files and photos. The 1TB is perfect for Macbook users. The hard drive arrived quickly and was securely packaged. The drive comes with a USB cable, which was handy. I plugged it into my Macbook and it asked if I wanted to reformat the drive to use with my Mac. It only took about a minute and it was ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Keeps clicking and disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk right out of the gate. Plugged it in, failed to install, and then, it just clicked a bunch. Tried it again a few minutes later and it installed. The drive showed up, but then started clicking and disappeared. Don’t they test this trash before it leaves the factory? Edit: seems to work ok when not plugged into a USB hub. Wish I had known they don’t work with hubs, though, as I only have one working USB port on my laptop. Would be nice if there was also a separate power supply.
customer_reviews.author: AKR

customer_reviews.title: Fast and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I had a 500Gb external HD I have been using for years. Didn't realize it was as small as 500Gb until I needed to use it. Was pleasantly surprised when I saw 2Tb external drive prices, so I went for this one because of the number of reviews. Just did a backup of my photos and music in quite a bit less time than on my older 500Gb drive. This made no discernible noise and was only slightly warm to the touch after a quick 100Gb backup. If you don't need an SSD drive, this one seems to be a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: PURCHASED 1/17/20 - FAILED 10/20/2020
customer_reviews.text: One would expect these drives to last AT LEAST A YEAR! Sadly, I have a few and now I will to need to incur the expense of buying WD Passports to copy my backups - which I should have purchased from the gitgo since the first one I ever purchased, back in 2014 is still working LIKE A CHAMP! Jesus, can these companies please make products that last?
customer_reviews.author: Rene Bechard

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about doing what I thought was an upgrade to my previous Toshiba hard drive. I like my other one so much, it took me probably 6 months before I even started finally using this one. Once I did, I was soooo disappointed. The first thing i noticed was that it is VERY slow to download things onto and off of. Now after only using it for not even 4 months, it is having connection problems and I have to unplug it and plug it back up for my computer to even read it. So not only is it slow, but the quality is just not there. I would not recommend this hard drive to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received product as promised. So far, it took ...
customer_reviews.text: Received product as promised. So far, it took over 8 hrs to backup 500gb of Mac data. Yes, I am concerned and I will update the review as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working Day One
customer_reviews.text: I plugged the hardrive in and copied my photos folder. I have 50gb worth of photos. Minutes into the transfer it stopped and I got a message saying that the device was disconnected. I didn’t disconnect it. It just malfunctioned. Now whenever I plug it in it says USB device not recognized.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just over a year
customer_reviews.text: Used it for gaming and it took a dump after about 15 months. It worked great when it worked. I bought it because it had great feedback for use with the xbox. But once i started playing modern warfare for a couple months in quit working. I don't know if it is because the hard drive isn't durable, or if some of the games were too demanding.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler Philip Adamo

customer_reviews.title: Fast, light, and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I make mirror backups of several computers (keeping files in the open, rather than consolidating them in a single archive file). I need to access them directly on the backup drive, not just restore them. This drive works great for that, serving as an external hard drive. It's small, light, and inexpensive. It's functional in a USB 2.0 port, but when used in a 3.0 port, it's super fast.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Easy to configure in Windows 10 & USB3 is fast!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a backup drive for my computer to store my files. I purchased this USB3 external SSD and I'm very happy. I'm used to USB2 performance with large "thumb drives" that take forever to exchange files. The USB3 is super fast in comparison. I now have my Windows laptop automatically doing daily backups. ("...don't need no cloud service that costs $10/month!") .
customer_reviews.author: 3petes

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I am more than a little disappointed with this drive. I had it up and running less than 2 weeks and it has irrecoverably crashed?! Toshiba support will not pony up the cost for data recovery either?? So, I lost 400GBs of images and am out $50. I will NEVER buy from Toshiba again.
customer_reviews.author: Coreyboy

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box you're up and running
customer_reviews.text: First External drive, after 2 crash & burns and total loss, the light bulb came on for this purchase. This product impressed me out of the box. Since being my first external drive, can't give any comparisons. Time will tell the tale thus, not 5 stars as of yet. working with Windows 10. cable sufficient, purchased a longer one just in case. Pending on your PC/ Laptop, transfer times may vary. For me it went quick.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Mex

customer_reviews.title: working with mac
customer_reviews.text: I'm mac user looking for an extra backup for by files. I had to reformat this external hard drive to exFAT format using the mac disc utility all and then it worked great. The product comes with a USB 3.0 cable so no extra hardware is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tori P.

customer_reviews.title: Back-up Your Data!
customer_reviews.text: It’s amazing how small this drive is. It doesn’t make any noise and it works perfectly as a back-up drive for my iMac. There’s really no excuse not to back-up all your data with an inexpensive option like this. I bought 2 of these drives that I use to back-up my entire hard drive. I keep one at a friend’s house in case of fire or theft and I switch it out with the one at my house each month.
customer_reviews.author: MysticKnight

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I love my External Hard Drive, I plugged it in and it took right off. I just don't know if it got everything I wanted to save on my laptop. Still checking it out, but so far I love it. I'm not real computer saavy, however can I access it from the hard drive on my computer, and second, can I back up pictures and things on my laptop and also use the same on my desktop, both HP Pavilion's. Just curious. Thanks again for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Country Girl Can Survive

customer_reviews.title: Tiny
customer_reviews.text: Tiny, and when I say that I mean it as a plus. I love this. We have a bookcase, cube style. Set up with a ps4, x box one, psvr and a router. The ps4 needed a bigger storage for media so we bought this. It fits in a tiny space and doubled the storage of the drive. So very happy about it we will be buying another one soon. I see it comes in different sizes too so we may explore a larger drive. Well worth looking into for additional storage and the set up couldn't be easier
customer_reviews.author: mr dead
